forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 2 to 6 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 72, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 2 to 9 mph.

weather_report:
As night unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, the city basks under a vast, clear sky, its tranquility marked by a gentle southwest breeze. With the temperature settling around a crisp 52 degrees, the evening invites a comforting layer—a light jacket or sweater should be your companion if you venture out to enjoy the glimmering city lights reflecting on the bay. The air is refreshingly clear without the usual embrace of fog, offering a serene panorama extending toward the Golden Gate and beyond, where the silhouettes of Marin stand elegantly against the night.

As dawn breaks tomorrow, expect the sun to cast a vibrant glow over the city, promising a delightful day ahead. Temperatures will rise to a pleasant high of around 72, cooling subtly by afternoon. The forecast suggests more of this clarity, with only whispers of the marine layer lingering along the coast. It’s the perfect setting for a stroll through the streets or a leisurely coffee at an outdoor café, where the warmth of the sun encourages a reflective pause while watching the world us unfold. This blend of sunny skies and gentle winds beckons a day of easy enjoyment; perhaps an intimate gathering at Mission Dolores Park or a visit to the bustling Ferry Building, where local flavors intermingle with the picturesque views. Dress simply yet comfortably, allowing for the ease that this lovely spring day invites.
